title: From Young Earth to Evolutionary Creationist: Part 2
description:
"Struggling with God & Origins" is a story about struggling with God. As a freshman college student, Denis Lamoureux lost his boyhood Christian faith because of evolution. With no spiritual foundation, he made medical school his idol and eventually became an immoral atheist. Yet by Gods grace, and in an answer to his mothers prayers, Denis read the Gospel of John and fell in love with the Prince of Peace while serving in the military as a United Nations peacekeeper on the island of Cyprus.

This is also a story about struggling with origins. Like most evangelical Christians, Lamoureux was a staunch young earth creationist. But the Lord had a plan for his life and led him to complete a PhD in theology and a PhD in biology. To his surprise, Lamoureux discovered that the Creator evolved intelligently designed living creatures that declare the glory of God. Through miraculous signs and wonders, the Lord Jesus called Dr. Lamoureux to be a college professor and to proclaim a peaceful relationship between his evangelical Christian faith and the modern evolutionary sciences.

Get "Struggling with God & Origins" here: https://amzn.to/40FPpwH (promoted link)

https://sites.ualberta.ca/~dlamoure/resumelamoureuxdenis.pdf

https://sites.ualberta.ca/~dlamoure/pdarwin1.pdf

https://sites.ualberta.ca/~dlamoure/pdarwin2.pdf

Intelligent Design Theory: The God-of-the-Gaps Rooted in Concordism (2018):
https://sites.ualberta.ca/~dlamoure/pterview.pdf

description:
Over the last several years, the Enneagram has become a widely used personality test among Christians. While some Christians praise it as a powerful tool, others warn that it has an occultic origin. Still others have simply questioned the scientific rigor and predictive value of the test. So where does the truth lie?

In this fascinating discussion, psychologist and PhD candidate Jay Medenwaldt provides a candid analysis of the Enneagram. For more from Jay including the science of the Ennegram, click here: https://jaymedenwaldt.com/2019/01/the-enneagram-science-and-christianity.html

The HEXACO personality test: https://hexaco.org/hexaco-online

An attachment styles test: https://attachment.personaldevelopmentschool.com

The video of Naranjo: https://youtube.com/watch?v=wlO3KJWnNd8&list=PLw-wFvtndeqs8U7eXRD8mRm0egYRpT1I0&index=1&t=81s

title: Practical Tips for Combating Medical Disinformation
description: How do you form opinions on topics of scientific and/or medical expertise that you lack? And how do you respond to people promoting disinformation in those same areas? I offer some thoughts.

title: Speaking Your Truth?
description: How (Some) Evangelical Apologists Misrepresent a Common Phrase (and What it Really Means)

title: Defending Christians Who Do Not Doubt God's Existence
description: Sarah Salviander recently said that she cannot doubt God's existence. Some folk think she was irrational to say that. Are they right?

title: Apologetic Advice on Addressing Objections to the Bible
description: If you are going to address objections to the Bible effectively, you first need to identify the underlying presuppositions that motivate the objection.

title: Alisa Childers: Moral Skeptic or Just Very Confused?
description: In this video, I interact with an excerpt from a new Sean McDowell interview with Alisa Childers in which she makes vague references to "the world" as a mere foil for her own views and appears to endorse a bracing moral skepticism.

title: Using the Red Pen with Red Pen Logic
description: A discussion of how Mr. B of Red Pen Logic misrepresents Brandon Robertson by confusing reading the Bible with preaching the Bible.

title: Can Skeptical Theism Save Biblical Violence?
description: According to skeptical theism, God could have reasons to allow evil and suffering in the world that we cannot even imagine. If our reasoning is so limited in this area, could it also be limited in understanding the nature of morality?

title: Progressive Christianity: A Caution and an Invitation
description: In this video, Randal speaks with philosopher Ben Cook about Ben's own journey to Eastern Orthodoxy along with some cautions for progressive Christianity.

title: Could God Command Christians to Commit Genocide?
Can Atheism Support Objective Morality?
description: Theists often claim that atheism cannot support an objective view of morality. In this video, I challenge that conventional wisdom and explain how atheism can support both objective morality and an objectively meaningful life.

title: Killing Canaanites? Debriefing the Copan/Rauser Debate
description: In this post-debate debrief, I review one key section of my debate with Paul Copan and explain how his view of Joshua entails that Israelites targeted and killed an indiscriminate number of Canaanite civilians.

title: Debriefing the Copan-Rauser Debate: Some Reflections
description:
I recently debated Paul Copan on the topic of the Canaanite conquest (link below). In this video, I offer some reflections on my methodological approach in the debate.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NU4UQtuNBl8&t=4217s

title: Is God Lacking in Praiseworthiness Because He Cannot Sin?
description: This video offers a quick rebuttal to a problem raised by atheist philosopher Jeff Lowder.

title: If an Atheist Asks About Biblical Violence DON'T SAY THIS!
description: The Bible depicts God commanding and commending apparent moral atrocities. So what do we say in response? Well for starters, don't say this!

title: The Worst Apologetics Talking Point Ever?
description: Christian apologists have some strong arguments and thought-provoking talking points. They also have some bad arguments and some really bad talking points. In this video, I describe what may be the worst apologetics talking point ever.

title: You Meet Ten Strangers in a Dark Alley...
description: Conservative commentator Dennis Prager argues that religion (and specifically, Judeo-Christian religion) makes people. He makes the point by asking us to imagine we meet ten strangers in a dangerous neighborhood. Would we feel better if they came from a Bible study?

title: Apologetics Protip: Don't Pretend to Know What You Don't Know
Virgin Girls for the Israelite Army? A Response to Paul Copan
description:
In this video, I offer a frank discussion of the moral problems presented by Numbers 31 and a critical response to Copan's treatment of the issue in his book Is God a Vindictive Bully? You can purchase Copan's book here: 

https://amzn.to/3RA9Ard (Promoted link)

title: Stoning Children in the Bible: A Response to Paul Copan
description:
This video provides a critique to Paul Copan's treatment of the stoning of children in Deuteronomy 21 in his book Is God a Vindictive Bully? You can purchase Copan's book here: 

https://amzn.to/3RA9Ard (Promoted link)

title: Grace in Judgment? On John MacArthur and Gavin Newsom
description: John MacArthur and his Grace Community Church have issued a scathing indictment of Gavin Newsom warning that his soul is in peril. I offer my response.

title: Gaslighting the Critics? If you call out Alisa Childers' falsehoods, you're not the problem
description: This video offers a direct reply to critics who claim that it is rude or mean or otherwise un-Christian to call out Alisa Childers for repeatedly and unapologetically spreading false and harmful claims about fellow Christians.

title: Thinking Theologically: Rebutting the Charge of Modern Sentimentalism
description: Many Christians today raise moral objections to common understandings of hell, biblical violence, and atonement. Can those objections be dismissed as "modern sentimentalism"?

title: Can Historians Appeal to Miracles?
description: This video provides a four minute critique of methodological naturalism.

title: Rebutting Christian Apologists Who Say Atheism is Rebellion Against God
description:
To learn more about this topic, see my book "Is the Atheist My Neighbor?" 

https://amzn.to/3qUhZe0

(promoted link)

title: Who Says Homosexuals Will Not Inherit God's Kingdom?
description: Systematic theology is about much more than citing Bible verses. And so, you can't settle the debate about same-sex relationships simply by citing a Bible verse like 1 Corinthians 6:9.

title: Christians, You Cannot Silence the Debate about Same-Sex Relationships
The Many Errors of Alisa Childers (Part 2)
description: In this video, I conclude my critical review of Alisa Childers' interview with Tim Stratton by pointing out how she appears to obfuscate on topics ranging from hell to the atonement to her view that progressive Christians are wolves in sheep's clothing.

title: The Many Errors of Alisa Childers (Part 1)
description: In this video, I provide an extended critical analysis of apologist Tim Stratton's recent interview with Alisa Childers.

title: COVID19 and Gay Pride Marches
description: In a 2020 article, Christian activist Rosaria Butterfield says Christians should be thankful for COVID19 because, among other things, it required lockdowns that prevented gay pride marches. I offer a reply.

title: Only 37% of Pastors Have a Biblical Worldview. Should I be Alarmed?
If You  Slur Another Group, Don't Qualify the Slur. Reject It!
Christians and Abortion: Must We Be Prolife Absolutists?
description: Further comments on abortion and responses to my YouTube critics.

title: Can Christians Disagree on the Ethics of Abortion?
description: Yes, they can. And do.

title: I'm Writing a Book on Christianity and Gay Marriage. Could I be Damned for It?
description: I hope to have my next book out in the fall in which I seek to provide an overview of the debate over gay marriage and the church. The goal is to explain how Christians can end up with very different affirming and non-affirming views. Some Christians believe that writing a book like that, that is, merely hosting the debate, is enough to imperil one's soul and place it under God's judgment. Are they right?

title: Atheist Philosopher Stephen Law on the Problem of Evil and Evil God
description:
Does the problem of evil provide an insurmountable objection to belief in God? Speaking of God, what if the nature of the divine being that exists is supremely evil rather than good? If it were, would we know? I discuss these and other issues with the esteemed public philosopher Stephen Law.

Visit Dr. Law online here: http://stephenlaw.blogspot.com

A link to Dr. Law's book (UK): https://amazon.co.uk/Philosophy-Gym-Short-Adventures-Thinking/dp/0747232717/ref=sr_1_1?crid=2QCDOL8IUZ8K2&keywords=the+philosophy+gym&qid=1660750241&sprefix=the+philosophy+gym%2Caps%2C305&sr=8-1

title: Did Brian McLaren Stay Christian?
description: In his new book "Do I Stay Christian?" Brian McLaren offers reasons to leave the faith and remain within it. In this video, I offer a reflection on the book and a consideration of the final question: Did Brian McLaren Stay Christian?

title: John Walton on Interpreting the Problem of the Canaanites
description: John Walton is one of the foremost evangelical biblical scholars of our day. In this video, we engage with a short article he wrote on interpreting the problem of the Canaanites culminating in some intriguing comments about spiritual interpretation

title: Is Hell God's Punishment or Ours?
description: A short overview of two different ways to think about hell inspired by a warning sign in a bathroom.

title: Can You Explain Canaanite Genocide By Way of Corporate Guilt?
description:
One standard attempt to defend the Canaanite genocide is by appealing to the notion of corporate guilt. In this video, I provide a response to that type of argument.

For further discussion see my book "Jesus Loves Canaanites": https://amzn.to/3Sx1Ojz (promoted link)

title: Should Christians Accept the Trinity? A Conversation with Dale Tuggy
description:
Should Christians accept the doctrine of the Trinity? Not according to philosopher Dale Tuggy. In this episode, Tuggy explains and defends his unitarian understanding of the doctrine of God.

Dale's book "What is the Trinity?" https://amzn.to/3QFu4Pp (promoted link)

Dale's book with Chris Date "Is Jesus Human and Not Divine?" https://amzn.to/3oVb1ET (promoted link)

Trinities Podcast: https://trinities.org/blog/podcasts/

title: Are Progressive Christians Non-Creedal? Debunking Alisa Childers' Misinformation
Mama Bear Apologetics Promotes Alisa Childers but Refuses to Talk to Me
description: I recently pointed out that a growing number of evangelical apologists who promote Alisa Childers' book "Another Gospel?" refuse to talk to me to defend her book. In this video, I give you an update on one of those aborted conversations with Hillary Morgan Ferrer of Mama Bear Apologetics.

title: What is Wrong with the Chicago Statement on Biblical Inerrancy?
description: According to Article IX of the Chicago Statement on Biblical Inerrancy, the human authors of Scripture were fully trustworthy in all that they "were moved to speak and write" and were wholly without "distortion or falsehood." But is that true?

title: What Progressive Christians are and why you don't need to be AFRAID of them
description:
To learn more, read my book Progressive Christians Love Jesus Too:

https://www.amazon.com/Progressive-Christians-Love-Jesus-Too-ebook/dp/B09Z4T2GDY/ref=sr_1_2?keywords=randal+rauser&qid=1658696146&sr=8-2

title: Is the Christian Life Best Sustained by Emotion or Argument?
description: Neither, it turns out.

title: Mike Winger's Bizarre Claim about the Progressive Christian View of Faith
description: Mike Winger claims that progressive Christians value having faith without regard for the content of that faith. That is an outrageous and patently false claim.

title: Mike Winger REJECTS the Thesis of Alisa Childers' book Another Gospel?
description: While Mike Winger and Alisa Childers are both outspoken critics of progressive Christianity, it turns out that Winger rejects the core claim of Childers' book that progressive Christianity is another religion.

title: Progressive Christianity, Its Evangelical Critics, and a Kinder, Gentler Me
description: My previous engagement with Michael Brown regrettably went sideways. And so, I resolve to be kinder and gentler in responding to the evangelical critics of progressive Christianity even as I provide a stark overview of the great harm they are doing.

title: One Faith No Longer? Debriefing the Conversation with George Yancey
description: This is a follow-up to my conversation with George Yancey in which I summarize nine objections/concerns with Yancey's thesis that progressive Christianity and evangelical Christianity constitute distinct religions.

title: Are Progressive Christians Another Religion? A Discussion with George Yancey
description:
In the 2021 book One Faith No Longer: The Transformation of Christianity in Red and Blue America, sociologists George Yancey and Ashlee Quosigk argue that progressive and evangelical Christianity should be viewed as different religions. In this video, I interview Professor Yancey on this provocative thesis. Check out the book below:

https://amzn.to/3IEpcXZ

title: The Genealogical Adam: A Conversation with Joshua Swamidass
description:
In 2019, Joshua Swamidass published The Genealogical Adam and Eve: The Surprising Science of Universal Ancestry. The book is bold and provocative as it offers an ingenious new perspective on the interminable origins debate. In this conversation, we work through Swamidass' theory and some of my key questions it raises. Pick up your own copy of this important book here!

https://amzn.to/3yzvrYp

title: Theodicy, Animal Suffering, and Naive Anthropopathism
Bad Defenses of Alisa Childers: A Response
description: While I have been unable to find any scholar willing to defend Alisa Childers' thesis that progressive Christianity is another religion, her book Another Gospel? has many defenders on social media. In this video, I offer a response to three common attempts to defend Childers' book.

title: How You LOVE is More Important than What You BELIEVE
description: In under seven minutes, I give a simple thought experiment to drive home the point: how you love is more important than what you believe; loving rightly is more important than believing rightly.

title: Manufacturing Progressive Christian Enemies: Lessons from Michael Kruger and Sean McDowell
description:
Theologian Michael Kruger was recently interviewed by Sean McDowell on his book The Ten Commandments of Progressive Christianity. In this video, I analyze the first few five minutes of the interview to demonstrate how McDowell and Kruger create progressive Christian enemies by invoking a simplistic binary opposition, placing progressives on the side opposed to Christianity, and arbitrarily selecting a single book to represent their disparate views.

For more discussion, read my book Progressive Christians Love Jesus Too: https://amzn.to/3aa6SZL

title: "Put Your Damn Bible Down"? How Sean McDowell spreads Misinformation About Progressive Christians
description:
Evangelical Christians like Sean McDowell claim that progressive Christians undermine truth. And yet, McDowell's own interaction with progressive Christianity is characterized by strawmanning, hasty generalization, cherry-picking, and other tools of misinformation. You can't serve truth by promoting falsehood.

For more discussion, read my book Progressive Christians Love Jesus Too:  https://amzn.to/3aa6SZL

title: What if Youre the Only Thing That Exists? On Talking to a Solipsist
description: Have you ever wondered that you might be the only thing that exists? Have you ever met someone else who thought that? If you did, how would you reason with them? How would you convince them that other things exist? In this video, we take on the topic of solipsism.

title: On the Idea of (Male) Privilege
description: Do men enjoy special privileges in society that women lack? Do we all possess some privileges and lack others? Here's my six-minute take.

title: Strawmanning Progressive Christians: Lessons from Mike Winger
description: In this video, I conclude my critique of Mike Winger's popular video on progressive Christians by pointing out how he strawmans the views of Richard Rohr and Brian Zahnd while exhibiting contempt for these fellow Christians and their views.

title: Progressive Christians, Evangelicals, and Alisa Childers: A Conversation with Joshua Swamidass
description:
Joshua Swamidass recently appeared on Capturing Christianity to discuss progressive Christianity and offer some criticisms of my book Progressive Christians Love Jesus Too. In this video, I take up the discussion with Swamidass further. For his conversation on Capturing Christianity, check out the link below:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PWFOfKReLdY&t=1023s

title: Mike Winger's Bad Teaching on Progressive Christianity (Part 3): Coming to Terms with Experience
description:
In this third installment of my critique of Mike Winger, I point out that his derision of the role of experience in theological reflection is fundamentally misguided: experience inevitably informs how we all think theologically.

For further discussion of these issues see my book "Progressive Christians Love Jesus Too."

https://amzn.to/3x7MRL0

title: Mike Winger's Bad Teaching on Progressive Christianity (Part 2)
description:
In this second installment of my Mike Winger critique, we focus on 2 minutes of his video as I point out several instances of fallacious and inconsistent reasoning and a consistent lack of charity in his analysis.

For a defense of progressive Christianity, see my book "Progressive Christians Love Jesus Too":

https://amzn.to/3ziwgqg

title: Mike Winger's Bad Teaching on Progressive Christianity (Part 1)
description:
YouTuber and pastor Mike Winger has amassed an impressive following on YouTube in part due to a series of critiques of progressive Christianity. In this video, I begin a careful analysis of one of those critiques.

For further discussion of progressive Christianity see my book "Progressive Christians Love Jesus Too":

https://amzn.to/3zdEZKl

title: Sean McDowell, George Yancey, & the Failed Attempt to Say Progressive Christians aren't Christians
description: In his new book "One Faith No Longer," sociologist George Yancey argues that conservative and progressive Christians no longer are part of the same religion. Sean McDowell recently interviewed Yancey and in this video I offer a critical response to both.

title: Progressive Christians are not trying to "get" you: A response to Whaddo You Meme?
description: The rhetorical attacks on progressive Christians are continuing to intensify with conservative Christians actively misrepresenting and strawmanning their views. In this video, I respond to one such case of misbegotten analysis from the popular online commentator Whaddo You Meme? (Jon McCray).

title: The Religion of Ricky Gervais
description: In this video, I analyze Ricky Gervais' naturalistic worldview and its religious identifying marks.

title: John Piper Recreates Christianity in his Image
description: In this video, I critique John Piper's narrow, sectarian take on mere Christianity.

title: Are We In a Post-Truth Culture? My Response to an Evangelical Talking-Point
Progressive Christians Love Jesus Too
description:
In this video I introduce my new book which provides a rebuttal to Alisa Childers' book "Another Gospel?" and a defense of progressive Christianity. Featuring a guest appearance from my new puppy Timbit!

Order your copy here! https://amzn.to/3y4Iu5u

title: How to Respond to Bad Arguments on Social Media
description: In this video, I address the question of how to respond to bad arguments on social media by countering the pro-Russian disinformation that one individual shared with me regarding the recent invasion of Ukraine.

title: Did Jesus Lack Empathy?
description: A reflection on Luke 2:41-50.

title: How to be 100% Christian When You're Only 50% Sure it is True
description: The title says it all. In this video, I explain how you can start on the path of being a Christian even in the midst of serious doubt.

title: Why It is OK for a Christian Apologist to have Doubts: A Response to James White
description: James White recently criticized apologist Mike Licona for saying he was 80% certain that Christianity was true. White went on to suggest that you shouldn't be an apologist unless you are certain. In this video, I offer a reply.

title: Hell: A Christian and Atheist Discuss the Doctrine of Divine Judgment
description:
In this video, Ben Watkins of Real Atheology presents some of his thoughts on the problem of hell and I offer a response as a Christian theologian. We agree about some things, disagree about others. But through it all we seek to model irenic and rigorous conversation and a search for mutual understanding.

Real Atheology on Twitter: @RealAtheology

Ben Watkins on Twitter: https://twitter.com/SpeedWatkins

title: A Hell of Our Own Making: A Sermon
description: When was the last time you heard a sermon on hell? This is my attempt at preaching the whole counsel of God.

title: William Lane Craig Says God May Command Us to "Drive Out Canaanites" in Our Day. I Respond.
description: You can purchase a copy of "Jesus Loves Canaanites" here: https://amzn.to/3ILUYBJ

title: How Christians Read Biblical Violence with Confirmation Bias
description: In this video, I explain how Christian reading of divine violence in the biblical text is often distorted by confirmation bias to defend particular theological assumptions about God.

title: When Jesus Exorcised Demons Was He Really Healing Epilepsy?
description: This video is based on a chapter from my book "Conversations with My Inner Atheist."

title: Hellbound? Reflections on the Christian doctrine of Damnation in Dialogue with the Korean Show
description: In this video, I consider the depiction of damnation in the new Korean Netflix show "Hellbound?" in which people await their fate to be dragged to hell and I bring that depiction into dialogue with the Christian doctrine of damnation.

title: How an Inerrant Bible Can Have Errors
description:
In this video, I explain how God can inerrantly include human theological errors within a plenarily inspired biblical text. For further discussion see my book Jesus Loves Canaanites:

https://amzn.to/3npfXlt

title: Answering Questions on Moving from Theism to Christianity and Biblical Violence
description: In this video, I answer two questions submitted to me. The first question concerns how people move from becoming a theist to becoming a Christian. The second question concerns the moral problem presented by the mass killing of the Noahic flood.

title: I Think I Might Be Dreaming
description: In this video, I address the perennial epistemological question, "Am I awake or am I dreaming?" with help from Fonzie and "Happy Days."

title: Why Theology Doesn't Make Contributions to Natural Science
description: Theology has repeatedly changed because of natural scientific advances. Does natural science ever change because of theological advances? And if not, is that a problem?

title: Don't Confuse Christ's Sovereign Ability to Speak Truth in All Things with Pluralism
Do Lacktheists have a Burden of Proof?
description: Yes, they do.

title: How Biblical Divinely Commanded Genocide Undermines Moral Knowledge
description:
Is it intrinsically evil to slaughter infants or does it depend on the context? Our moral knowledge says one thing, biblical passages like 1 Samuel 15:3 seem to say something else.

For further discussion, see my book "Jesus Loves Canaanites":

https://amzn.to/3FGEz05

title: Prolife Christians Who Support Child Killing
description: Defending the morality of the Canaanite genocide has disastrous consequences for a consistent Christian ethic as I explain in this video.

title: A Short Defense of Blind Faith
description: The title tells it all.

title: Truth and Reconciliation Day: A Devotional Reflection
Fundamentalist Bible Reading and Literally False Descriptions of God
description:
In this video, I explain how a passage like Exodus 32 forces fundamentalist Christians to abandon their "literalist" approach to Bible reading or face stark theological consequences.

You can watch the debate here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-t52La_cY0o&ab_channel=StandingForTruth

title: The Problem with a High View of God
description: Many Christians say that we should have a "high view of God". But what do they mean and is it worth having?

title: My Body, My Choice: On the Anti-Christian Logic of Christian Anti-Vaxxers
description:
I heard a Christian woman say that she is not getting the COVID19 vaccine because her body is the temple of the Spirit and, "My body, my choice."

I beg to differ.

title: Eight Problems of Biblical Violence
description: A brief survey of eight distinct problems of biblical violence that every Christian needs to consider.

title: i feel like dying: A Conversation on Depression
description:
In this video, I have a conversation with my brother, Rick Rauser, about the reality of clinical depression.

If you are struggling with depression and need help, here is a list of suicide crisis lines by country:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_suicide_crisis_lines

title: Being a Christian is not the Same Thing as Being Saved
description: Christians often confuse the questions "Is he a Christian?" and "Is he saved?" But they are very different questions.

title: Drunkards, Sin, and God's Kingdom: A Reappraisal
description: I 1 Corinthians 6:10, Paul tells us that drunkards are unrighteous and that they will not inherit the Kingdom of God. In short, Paul seems to view the alcoholic as a wicked sinner in rebellion against God. But what if we think about alcoholism from the perspective of modern psychiatry as primarily a therapeutic rather than a moral problem?

title: Why Christians Should Accept that Jesus Had False Beliefs
description: In this video, I explain how, in virtue of his human psychology, Jesus gained wisdom and knowledge over time and this would include Jesus having held beliefs at one time which he later came to recognize as false.

title: The Shocking Violence of Greg Boyd's Non Violent God
description: Greg Boyd's book "The Crucifixion of the Warrior God" has been widely praised for offering a provocative non-violent account of biblical violence. But a closer look reveals the book actually attributes surprisingly violent actions and intentions to God.

title: William Lane Craig's Failed Defense of the Canaanite Genocide
description: In this video, I offer a critique of William Lane Craig's recent defense of the Canaanite conquest which amounts to a failed attempt to defend ethnic cleansing and genocide.

title: How Professional Wrestling can Help Us Understand the Bible
description: In this video, I argue that in the same way that we can appreciate professional wrestling as performance even if it is not a conventional sport, so we can appreciate non-historical aspects of the biblical narrative even if they are not literally true.

title: Strawmanning Atheists: A Critique of Frank Turek
description: Frank Turek claims that atheists "steal from God." In this video, I explain how Turek's argument is based on a strawman of atheistic and a very uncharitable metaphorical framing of atheism conceptual reflection in terms of criminal theft.

title: On the Holy Piety of Getting Angry with God
description: Some Christians think that the life of Christian discipleship is a life of victorious Christian living in which we are content in all things. But what if Christian discipleship has room for the full range of human emotional responses to God including doubt, sadness, disappointment, and even anger?

title: Biblical Violence and Epistemology: A Conversation with Counter Apologist
description:
In this video, I have a conversation with atheist blogger Counter Apologist over biblical violence and epistemology in conversation with my book "Jesus Loves Canaanites."

You can watch Counter Apologist's original video critique here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8vWgjQtutRw&ab_channel=CounterApologist

title: Does the Bible include Evil Moral Teaching?
description: In this video, I argue that the mandate to punish people by pelting them to death with rocks is always immoral and I seek to appeal to the moral intuitions of others in support of this claim by way of an actual modern instance of stoning. If we agree that stoning is always wrong, we must consider standard claims about biblical inerrancy in light of that fact.

title: Jesus Dwells within You Really but not Literally
description: In this video, I explore the importance of metaphor in theological language as a powerful heuristic tool for exploring reality. We focus, in particular, on the spatial metaphor of Jesus and the Holy Spirit dwelling within the Christian.

title: On the Idea of Provisional Hospitality
description: Henri Nouwen said that listening is the highest form of hospitality. But when do we decide that a position is sufficiently immoral or harmful or flatly false that we no longer grant people who hold it the hospitality of space to share and defend their views?

title: Don't Exploit Mental Illness for the Sake of Your Apologetics
description: The title is the description: Don't exploit mental illness (e.g. schizophrenia, clinical depression) to provide anecdotal validations of your worldview. It's unseemly and inappropriate.

title: Killing the Children of Jericho How Paul Copan Avoids the Question
description: In this video, we listen to an excerpt of a debate in which Paul Copan is asked directly about the killing of children as referenced in the slaughter of all the residents of Jericho, men and women, young and old (Joshua 6:21). Rather than address directly the ethics of slaughtering children and infants, Copan deflects from the question by raising other issues pertaining to hyperbole, driving out language, and the goal of eradicating Canaanite culture.

title: Why the Logic of the Canaanite Genocide is Fundamentally Flawed
description: In this short video, I rebut the claim that the Israelites needed to kill the Canaanites in order to maintain their own moral purity. On the contrary, I point out that participation in war crimes like genocide and ethnic cleansing is fundamentally corrupting for the moral status of a people. Thus, the Israelites would have morally corrupted their own community by participating in such war crimes, thereby defeating the very rationale for their actions.

title: Deconstructing a Frank Turek Tweet
description: In this video, I explain how a recent tweet from Frank Turek unfairly stigmatizes people who deconvert from Christianity as being motivated by a desire to justify a particular type of 'sexual behavior'.

title: The Ten Worst Defenses of the Canaanite Genocide
description: Christian apologists have offered many bad arguments to explain how God commanded the genocidal slaughter of ancient peoples. In this video, I survey the ten worst.

title: Why I don't Recommend William Lane Craig for Church Apologetics
description: William Lane Craig's book "Reasonable Faith" is a very fine apologetic textbook for a Christian apologetic subculture that is interested in this set of questions. But in this video, I explain why it is less relevant to the average church goer.

title: What if Jesus Loves Canaanites?
description: In this video, I introduce my new book "Jesus Loves Canaanites" by outlining the problem of the biblical genocide and outlining a solution rooted in the radical life and teaching of Jesus Christ. You can get your own copy of the book here: https://amzn.to/3eptjs7

title: Euthanasia in Canada: A Panel Discussion
description:
In this video, I have a discussion with four medical practitioners/caregivers in Canada about euthanasia, palliative care, and Canada's MAID (Medical Assistance in Dying) legislation. To let your political representatives know about your concern with MAID, visit this website:

canadiansforconscience.ca

Also, see this website regarding conscience protection:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LtTEtrKWUk8

title: Preach it! On Religious Conversions to Atheism
description: In this video, I consider how some atheists experience a dramatic, effectively religious conversion to atheism, one that leads them to adopt a strident, evangelistic attitude toward others which is remarkably similar to the fundamentalist Christian street preacher.

title: Coming to Terms with Mystery: A Brief Reflection on Cognitive Closure
description: In this video, I offer a reflection on cognitive closure (the limitations of our minds to grasp reality) and the implications that fact has for epistemic humility.

title: Can You Be Gay and Christian?
description: In this video, I explore the meaning of the question "Can You Be Gay and Christian?" Because, before you give an answer, you first need to figure out what the question even means.

title: Becoming Catholic: An Interview with Catholic Apologist Jimmy Akin
description: In this conversation, we hear the story of how Jimmy Akin, Senior Apologist at Catholic Answers, converted to the Roman Catholic Church. We close off with a fascinating discussion about his eclectic podcast Jimmy Akin's Mysterious World. https://www.jimmyakin.org/

title: Predators in the Church An Investigator Speaks on the Ravi Zacharias Case
description: In this interview, I discuss the Ravi Zacharias case with Bob Stenhouse, the Executive Director of Veritas Solutions. You can visit Veritas Solutions online here: https://veritassolutions.net/

title: C.S. Lewis Warned that Apologetics is Dangerous. Was he Right?
Why Reason Always Requires Faith: Explained in 6 Minutes
description: The video freezes for a bit but I'm not bothering to re-record this video! At least the audio is fine.

title: How Not to Read the Bible: Lessons from "Footloose"
description: In this video, I consider the lamentable Bible reading of Ren McCormack (Kevin Bacon) as he uses biblical passages out of context as a pretext to get the town to lift their ban on school dances. All from the classic 1984 teen movie "Footloose".

title: The Awfulness of Franklin Graham in a Single Tweet
description: Franklin Graham supports a profoundly anti-Christian politician and professes to care about human rights while only caring about the rights of his special-interest group.

title: Should Christians Work with Skeptics to Do Good?
description: Do you think Christians and skeptics should do good works together? Join my fundraiser for the Against Malaria Foundation! https://www.againstmalaria.com/FundraiserGroup.aspx?FundraiserID=8420

title: One of the most outrageous things a Christian apologist ever said
description: In this video, I critique Greg Koukl's reading of Romans 1 in which he impugns atheists, agnostics, those of "false religion" and anyone else who doesn't accept Koukl's understanding of the existence and nature of God with maximal conviction.

title: Are evangelicals people of truth? Maybe not.
description: Evangelicals like to talk about truth but do they live it? Are they people of truth?

title: What is Sin?
description: In this video, I summarize the Christian doctrine of sin from a nomological perspective based on a definition from Millard Erickson

title: One of the most profound statements I ever heard on race and racism came from a game show host
Christians and Skeptics Supporting the World's Most Effective Charity?
description:
American Christians & Skeptics vs. Canadian Christians & Skeptics fighting malaria. Who is more generous? You decide!

To donate to the American fundraiser, click here:

https://www.AgainstMalaria.com/AmericanChristiansSkeptics

To donate to the Canadian fundraiser, click here:

https://www.AgainstMalaria.com/CanadianChristiansSkeptics

title: Did I experience demonic oppression? A critical reflection
description: In this video, I discuss a 1993 experience of putative demonic possession and consider whether it is better explained simply in terms of sleep paralysis.

title: Why a meaningful life is not the same thing as a life that does (or does not) go on forever
description:
Christians sometimes argue that life is only meaningful if it goes on forever. Atheists sometimes argue that life is only meaningful if it doesn't go on forever. 

Theyre both wrong.

title: Does "Stairway to Heaven" include a secret message from the devil backwards?
description: The single most infamous song of the backward masking craze of the 1980s was surely Led Zeppelin's "Stairway to Heaven." A message from the devil or a trick of the imagination? I'll say the latter. But when we were kids, playing "Stairway to Heaven" backward on the record player was still a memorable way to spend an afternoon. For further discussion see "The Sixth Spiritual Law and Playing 'Stairway to Heaven' backward" in "What's So Confusing About Grace?" https://amzn.to/3fc5aoN

title: Can you be saved if you don't believe God raised Jesus from the dead?
The Limits of Steelmanning
description: Strawmanning is a fallacy in which you present (and then reject) a position or argument based on it's weaker form. Steelmanning is the opposite: it involves a presentation of an opposing view in its strongest form. But are there any limits to steelmanning? For example, can (and should) you steelman a racist view like white supremacy?

title: Three Essential Elements of Every Christian Apologetic
description: In this video, I summarize my philosophy of Christian apologetics in terms of three essential pillars: arguments, character, and hope.

title: Why would God let rapists and murderers into heaven?
Being Prolife is Not the Same Thing as Being Anti Abortion
The Fact that You Were Once a Christian Does not Make Your Atheism More Rational
Atheists having conversations with their inner Christian
description: I believe that Christians should be willing to have a conversation with their 'inner atheist,' that inner voice of questioning and doubt. But that goes both ways: atheists, too, should be ready to have a conversation with their inner Christian.

title: 7 Steps to Build Christian Communities that Don't Lose the Young
How Christians engage in special pleading when they try to justify bad biblical behavior
description: Many conservative Christians believe that men should follow the Billy Graham Rule to never be alone with a woman who is not your life. Unless you're a king like David: then you can climb into bed with a young virgin girl. In this video, I criticize that kind of painful special pleading.

title: Does God command genocide in the Bible?
description:
In this video, I offer a response to a short clip from an interview between Sean McDowell and Charlie Trimm. For the full McDowell interview, see here: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OW12NwudLHc&ab_channel=Dr.SeanMcDowell

title: Why do some agnostics call themselves atheists? And should we care?
description: In this video I consider why some agnostics are calling themselves atheists and I offer three reasons why we should oppose that semantic development.

title: Should Apologists Get Rich Defending the Christian Faith, or is that a Bad Apologetic?
description: In this video, I suggest that those who donate to Christian apologetics organizations that pay their apologists more than $200,000 per year would be better served in purchasing mosquito nets to fight malaria. In my view, that is a far better apologetic for a skeptical world.

title: If Ravi Zacharias engaged in immoral conduct, does that invalidate his ministry?
Why does theology adapt to science but science doesn't adapt to theology?
description: This is a common question I often hear from skeptics and Christians alike. In this video, I explain the difference based on a chapter from my recent book "Conversations with My Inner Atheist".

title: Whatever Happened to the Bereans? My Response to Ravi Zacharias Defenders
description: In this video I offer a response to defenders of Ravi Zacharias who attacked me for posting the personal statement of a Christian scholar who investigated the allegations that Zacharias engaged in inappropriate sexual contact with women at his spa.

title: Can Stryper be heavy metal if they are Christian?
description: Following the release of Stryper's new album "Even the Devil Believes," popular heavy metal website blabbermouth.net posted a review which praises the musicianship and musicality, but gives the album a poor review because of uplifting Christian lyrics that allegedly contradict the spirit of rock and roll. In this review, I offer my response.

title: A Miracle isn't a Violation of the Laws of Nature, so What is It?
description: In this video, I critique two definitions of miracle and offer an account rooted in the Bible and popular parlance in which 'miracle' is perfectly compatible with the laws of nature and secondary causal processes.

title: Can a historian accept that God raised Jesus from the dead on historical grounds?
description: Many people believe that historians should be closed, in principle, to 'theological' explanations. This 'methodological naturalism' precludes the possibility that historians could accept the resurrection of Jesus on historical grounds. In this video, I argue on the contrary that historians should be open, in principle, to God as a historical explanation for the resurrection of Jesus.

title: Reading What the Bible Says About Dogs to My Dog
description: In this video, I read what the Bible says about dogs to my dog, Sonny. I think I hurt his feelings.

title: A Quick Response to Atheists Who Claim They Have No Burden of Proof
description: Some atheists claim that they don't have a burden of proof because only positive existential claims have a burden of proof and they, by contrast, are making a negative existential claim. Does that make sense?

title: What is the Flying Spaghetti Monster (and why should I care)?
description: Have you ever heard atheists, skeptics, and humanists talk about the Flying Spaghetti Monster? What is that, exactly, and where did it come from? In this video, I explain the origins of the FSM and why you should care about it.

title: Why Jesus Mythicism is a Conspiracy Theory
description: In this video, I respond to a popular YouTube Jesus Mythicist named Godless Atheist by explaining how Jesus Mythicism is indeed a conspiracy theory. I also respond to Godless Atheist's ill-tempered comments. For further discussion see my debate with Godless Atheist here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8781a1zPN28&t=707s

title: Christians, don't let heresy hunters scare you from asking hard questions
description: At the Council of Worms, Martin Luther famously defended his convictions by saying "To go against conscience is neither right nor safe. I cannot, and I will not recant. God help me, Amen." Luther was honest about his questions and doubts, even though it could've cost him his life. So why are we afraid? Share your questions and your doubts. https://amzn.to/32pneG1

title: Is Bart Ehrman a Spiritual Terrorist?
description: In this video, I respond to Hank Hannegraff's claim that Bart Ehrman is a spiritual terrorist. The short answer is that it helps nobody if we begin to accuse one another of being terrorists simply because we disagree about important matters.

title: Conversation With my Inner Atheist
description: I am a Christian theologian, but for more than thirty years, I have shared my faith journey with an inner atheist. In this book, I invite her into the conversation: https://amzn.to/2YkPOar

title: The Absurdity of Jesus Mythicism in Five Minutes
description: When less than 1% of relevant scholars deny that Jesus existed and that tiny minority all happen to be atheist activists who are openly hostile toward Christianity, you are right to be skeptical...

title: Do Atheists Hate God?
description: Some Christians believe that atheists hate God, indeed that they are sinfully suppressing the fact that deep down, they really know that God exists. Is this a defensible position? In this video, I take a closer look. For further discussion, see my book "Is the Atheist My Neighbor?" https://amzn.to/33TosvH

title: 5 Signs You Were Raised Fundagelical
description:
Fundagelicals are a fascinating hybrid of Christian fundamentalists and evangelicals and in this video, I discuss five ways to know that you too, were raised in this tribe. Note, the video freezes for about three seconds from 11:33-40. At that point, I just started talking about dispensationalism.

This video was inspired by my awesome book "What's So Confusing About Grace?" which you can get at Amazon:

https://amzn.to/3iqhNwW

title: Five Signs that Atheist You're Talking to is Not Serious
description: Over the years, I have seen Christians invest countless hours attempting to reason with atheists who are overtly contemptuous of their Christian and theistic beliefs. While there may be value in such exchanges, Christians should enter into them with their eyes wide open. And so, as a way to understand what you might be getting into, I offer five signs that atheist you're talking to is not serious.

title: Is general revelation enough?
description: In this video, I explain the difference between general and special revelation. Next, I point out the danger of thinking that general revelation is "all you need". When it functions as it should, general revelation should drive us to seek to understand God's special revelation.

title: The Four Saddest Words I Hear as a Christian Apologist
description: In this video, I talk about the four saddest words I hear as a Christian apologist: "That ship has sailed."

title: Can You Preach it at Auschwitz?
description: Many people think the adequacy of a theology of providence or a theodicy is dependent on whether it can be "preached at the gates of Auschwitz". But is that a reasonable criterion? In this video, I suggest otherwise.

title: What would it take for you to give up your faith? (And is that a good question?)
description: Atheists and skeptics often ask Christians under what conditions they would give up their faith. In this video, I point out what is right and what is wrong about that question.

title: When atheists compare God to Santa Claus, leprechauns, and flying spaghetti monsters
description: In this video, I survey five rhetorical categories of comparison that village atheists/new atheists make with belief in God. And  I explain why each one of them is little more than an ignorant attempt to poison the well.

title: Should We Believe William Lane Craig's Advice on Doubt?
description: In this video, I offer a critical response to three points of advice William Lane Craig gives to Christians who face doubts.

title: Responding to a Misbegotten Attempt to Defend Biblical Inerrancy
description: Joshua 10 describes God as making the sun stand still. While we now know that the earth orbits around the sun (rather than vice versa), inerrantists defend the inerrancy of this passage by claiming the language is only phenomenological: they only described what they saw. But is that a defensible position or does this text represent a simple objection to biblical inerrancy?

title: Theology, Worldview, and the Death of My Father
description: In this video, I reflect on the death of my father to Alzheimer's in theological perspective while interacting with the eulogy I delivered at his memorial service in April 2019. The lesson: A Christian worldview should equip you to view life, suffering, and death in the light of hope, grace, and the cross.

title: Hucksters, Heretics, Hypocrites ... and Tim Challies
description: In this video, I offer a critical response to Tim Challies' video "7 Marks of a False Teacher" by demonstrating that he conflates two (or three) different groups and proposes empty and self-defeating marks of false teaching. In short, it's not helpful advice.

title: Randal Rauser Live Stream
Is Morality Objective? Randal Rauser & Converse Contender Vs Brenton & 5 By 5
description: In this debate hosted by "Modern Day Debate," my friend Converse Contender and I argue that moral values and duties are objective.

title: Why Theology is Not Simply Listing Bible Verses
description: Many evangelicals seem to think that systematic theology consists simply of listing the relevant Bible verses for a particular topic or doctrine. But there is much more to it than that as I explain in this video.

title: Steve Hays Regularly Attacked Me. Here are My Thoughts on His Passing
description: This morning, I received word that Calvinist blogger Steve Hays died. For a decade, he attacked me online, called me an apostate, even trying to get me fired and disciplined by my church (!). Here are my thoughts on his passing.

title: Why I Don't Talk About the Sensus Divinitatis When I Talk About Belief in God
description:
Alvin Plantinga famously appeals to the existence of a sensus divinitatis, a "sense of the divine", as the cognitive faculty by which one can form justified and rational belief in God apart from evidence. In this video, I explain why I prefer to argue for properly basic belief in God by way of the more mundane cognitive process of testimony. You can watch the Modern Day Debate that I debrief in this video here:
 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2lcp2l8IsJA&t=496s

title: Alisa Childers, "Historic Christianity," and the Atonement
description: In this video, I consider how Alisa Childers adopts an idiosyncratic definition of "historic Christianity" that reduces the essentials to Paul's creed in 1 Corinthians 15:3-7. Next, I point out how Childers attacks progressive Christians by claiming without evidence that "most" progressive Christians reject the core doctrine of substitutionary atonement.

title: Sonny the Lhasa Apso in Dandelions
description: This is Sonny. He is almost 17 and he's like the canine version of Mr. Rogers. Today, his slow, happy walk through a field of dandelions brought a smile to my face so I am sharing it with you. Be kind and enjoy every day with those you love.

title: Four Levels of Doubt
description: From the principled recognition of human fallibility to the all-embracing crisis of faith, I survey the four levels of doubt and explore their central role in the life of faith.

title: Does Christian Faith Mean Giving Up on Evidence?
description: Many people think that faith is inconsistent with evidence: if you have faith you don't need evidence. However, when Jesus made claims about himself he always provided evidence to support his claims. Faith is not a step into the darkness: it is a reasoned exercise of trust based upon the evidence that has been provided.

title: Why Pinecreek Doug's Flying Man Can't Get Off the Ground
description: In this video, I explain how Pinecreek Doug conflates psychological and epistemological questions with his Flying Man Thought Experiment. And for that reason, his critique of 1 Corinthians 15:3-8 cannot get off the ground.

title: The Jesus Creed Meets the Flying Man Creed
description: Atheist YouTuber and provocateur Pinecreek Doug has produced a "Flying Man Creed" which appears to be an attempt to undermine the creed of 1 Corinthians 15:3-8 by way of reductio ad absurdum or a slippery slope. Alas, Doug's Flying Man Creed cannot even get off the ground.

title: I could never worship a God who...
description: Has anybody ever said to you, "I could never worship a God who [fill in the blank]." Does that make sense? In this video, I take a look at that all-too-common declaration.

title: Is It Okay For Pastors to Have Doubts? Lessons from John the Baptist
description: Jesus said of John the Baptist, "Truly I tell you, among those born of women there has not risen anyone greater than John the Baptist..." And yet, at one point in his life, John seriously doubted Jesus. So maybe it is okay to have doubts.

title: What is 'Progressive Christianity' and why does Alisia Childers think it's so dangerous?
description: In this video, I continue my critical response to Alisia Childers attack on progressive Christianity as being dangerous. I point out that her definition of progressive Christianity is fatally flawed and I identify several instances where she fails to recognize that her own beliefs represent an interpretation of the Bible and Christianity.

title: Can a pastor have doubts?
description: In this video, I offer a critical response to Alisa Childers and Cameron Bertuzzi of Capturing Christianity as they discuss Ms. Childers' former pastor who once described himself as agnostic. The video raises an important question: "Can a pastor have doubts?" The answer, I think, is that at times pastors will likely have doubts. The real question is whether they have a congregation ready and willing to journey with them through the valley of doubt.

title: Ravi Zacharias on Homosexuality: A Critical Response
description: In this video, I consider Ravi Zacharias' response to a question about homosexuality. In my response, I argue that Mr. Zacharias offered a non-answer to the specific question that was asked. I also argue that he framed the issue poorly and I offer an interpretation of the question that I believe is more sympathetic to the questioner and more illuminating for the audience.

title: Is progressive Christianity worse than atheism?
description: In this video, I offer a response to Christian apologist Alisa Childers' article "5 Signs Your Church Might be Heading Toward Progressive Christianity."

title: The Fallacies of the Theological Conservative
description: In this video, I look at how conservative Baptist theologian Russell Moore poisons the well, exhibits confirmation bias, and strawmans in his treatment of universalism. The Golden Rule instead commits us to treating the views of others with the same nuance and rigor that we'd want our views to be treated.

title: Should Christians defend honor killings?
description: Christians today react with horror and revulsion when they read of parents who kill their children in the name of parental honor. But the Law in the Old Testament also presents cases where parents kill their children in the name of parental honor. So should Christians revisit their principled moral rejection of honor killing or should they reconsider how they read the Bible?

title: The Resurrection of Jesus as a Historical Miracle
description: One can believe in the resurrection of Jesus by faith, but can one also believe it as the result of a historical investigation? In this video, I explain how one can do precisely that by reasoning through the implications of 1 Corinthians 15:3-8.

title: Having once been a Christian doesn't mean you understand Christianity
description: The other day, I posted a tweet in which I pointed out that having been a Christian doesn't automatically entail that you have an informed understanding of Christianity. That simple and important observation received significant atheist blowback, blowback which almost completely missed the point.

title: "Religion flies planes into buildings." And My Response.
description: Atheists sometimes say "Science doesn't fly planes into buildings. Religion flies planes into buildings." This is a nonsense talking point as I explain in this video.

title: God and the Invisible Gardener of Naturalism
description: In this video, I address the popular story that compares theological claims about God to claims about an invisible gardener. I point out that the objection applies equally to atheistic claims such as the popular theory of naturalism. I also note that it simply misunderstands the nature of theorization.

title: The Ad Hominem Fallacy
description: According to the ad hominem fallacy, it is fallacious to critique a person rather than their argument. However, not every critique of the person is an example of the ad hominem fallacy.

title: Debating the Existence of God: The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly
description: In this video, I consider the value of debating the existence of God -- in particular, it provides a tidy summary of arguments and it is a great way to draw a crowd. I also note the bad and ugly, in particular the way that debates are set up as zero-sum games that reinforce tribalism. I then consider whether there is a better medium of intellectual exchange than the traditional debate.

title: C.S. Lewis, Allegory, and the Cursing Psalms
description: In this video, I consider C.S. Lewis' attempt to allegorize the ugliness of the imprecatory psalms, and in particular, his infamous attempt to suggest that we read the bludgeoning of a Babylonian baby as a symbolic call to purge sinful impulses. Can Lewis help us re-read the violence and hatred in the psalms? I'm not so sure.

title: If God commanded you to sacrifice your child, would you? Here's my response
description: If God commanded you to sacrifice your child, would you? The answer is simple: God wouldn't command that. And if you still want to consider the scenario as a per impossibile claim, you can do that with any moral system, not just divine command theories of ethics.

title: Should we hope that God has a reason for allowing evil?
description: Many people find the idea that God has a reason for allowing great evils to be implausible, even offensive. But does that make sense? Should we really prefer that evil occur for no reason at all? Or should we hope there is a reason, even if we can't understand it? In this video, I take the latter position by way of a reflection on my father's death.

title: Is God punishing us with COVID-19?
description: In this video, I consider the claim that God is punishing people with COVID-19 by considering the three factors that must be present for a punishment to be just. I then consider what implication this might have for how we read the Bible.

title: Is the Misery of Hell Self-Imposed?
description: C.S. Lewis famously said the gates of hell are locked on the inside, and many people think this idea that the misery and suffering of hell are self-imposed somehow lessens the moral problems with the doctrine. But does it? In this video, I suggest otherwise.

title: What's the Biggest Problem with Annihilationism?
description: Annihilationism has become popular among evangelicals in recent years. But as I discuss in this video, there is an interesting, unique, and rarely discussed objection to it.

title: Maltese pup growling with baby-face filter
description: When I'm feeling down, I watch this video my daughter made of our Maltese growling in rage with a baby-face filter. Then I feel better.

title: Does Open Theism Have an Advantage in Explaining Evil?
description: Open theists often argue that God's not knowing the future actions of free creatures provides a theodicy to justify why he allows evil. But is that really true? In this 2 minute video I use a clip from "X-Men: Days of Future Past" to challenge that theodicy.

title: How to respond to Ken Ham in about a minute
description: Ken Ham says that you should interpret Genesis 1 literally because the text refers to six literal days. Is that right, or has this focus on the meaning of "day" within Genesis 1 led Ken to miss the meaning of Genesis 1?

title: Everything Wrong with this Christian Worldview Chart
description: Evangelical Christians love their worldview charts. But are they any good? In this short video, I offer a critique of one of them.

title: Certainty v.  Doubt: Are you certain that doubt is the problem?
description: Some Christians claim that we ought to be certain of our beliefs. Others reply that certainty is actually a problem and that having doubt is far better. What if they're both right ... and wrong?

title: How (Not) to Read like a Christian Fundamentalist
description: Christian fundamentalism encourages people to think in binary, all-or-nothing categories. In short, if there is any theological or moral error in some cultural product (a book, a film, a song) then I should avoid all of it. Is that true?

title: God Forgives Serial Killers
description: According to Christianity, serial killers can be saved. Is that a reason to think that Christianity is false? Many people believe so. They find the notion of forgiveness for such heinous offenses to be immoral, they find the appeal for forgiveness to be flippant, and they find the idea of restoration occurring in an instant to be offensive. Are those good objections?

title: Do 33,000 Christian Denominations present an objection to the truth of Christianity?
description: In this video, I critique the argument that disagreement among Christians provides a good reason to believe that Christian revelation is not from God.

title: What the Bible Says About Dogs (and Why It Matters)
description: Many Christians think the Bible is a handbook for all of life. In this video, I test that idea by considering what the Bible says about dogs. (Spoiler: it ain't good.) So, must we choose between the Bible and our dogs?

title: The Three Worst Reasons to Reject Universalism
description: Christian universalism is the view that everybody will eventually be reconciled to God in Jesus Christ. There are good reasons to reject universalism. However, there are also many bad reasons and these are the three worst.

title: If an atheist says they dont think hell will be so bad, what do you say in reply?
description: In this video, I explain why hell is not going to be a party and that anyone who rejects God thereby ensures their own misery.

title: Materialism and Consumerism: What's the Difference?
description: In this video, I explain how materialism and consumerism are two different attitudes toward material things. Both of them represent a distortion of true value.

title: Why would God send people to hell?
description: The doctrine of hell constitutes one of the most serious moral objections to Christian belief: if God is all love, why would he send people there? One standard reply is to say that God doesn't send people to hell; rather, they send themselves. Does this reply make sense?

title: Is the lack of consensus among Christian theologians a problem?
description: Atheists and skeptics often claim that Christian theology is an illegitimate knowledge discourse because theologians fail to achieve consensus. And this, it is claimed, contrasts with science where such consensus is regularly achieved. In this short video, I provide four responses to that common objection.

title: Atheistic Fundamentalism: Understanding indoctrination in the non-religious
description: In this video, I provide an overview of three components common to indoctrination and provide several examples of them in the fundamentalism of the new atheists.

title: Beyond the Anathema: A Catholic/Protestant Dialogue
description: Henri Nouwen once said that listening is the highest form of hospitality. On October 31, 2019, Protestant theologian Randal Rauser invited Catholic apologist Trent Horn to share his Catholic views for a Protestant seminary so that they might better understand the Catholic faith. This is that exchange. (We did have some technological glitches, but we still made it work!)

title: Fundamentalist Biblical Interpretation: A Critique
description: Many fundamentalist and evangelical Christians say that the Bible should be interpreted "literally word for word". But is this literal approach to Bible interpretation correct? Does it even make sense? In this short lecture, I offer a critique of this widely held popular interpretive principle.

title: Some Christians say the world is getting worse. Are they right?
description: Many conservative Christians believe the world is progressively getting worse. In this video, I challenge that assumption by way of a thought experiment which provides evidence that North America, at least, is becoming a more just society.

title: Would you rather be a Muslim who acts like Jesus or a Christian who doesn't?
description: Is it more important to believe the right things or to do the right things? In this video, I propose we answer that question by way of a thought experiment which considers two very different responses to genocide. The thought experiment is based on an illustration from my book "You're Not as Crazy as I Think,' pp. 137-140.

title: Can you be a Christian if you doubt?
description: I grew up in a Christian tradition that greatly valued the certainty of one's convictions: the "man of faith" was the one who fully trusted God, not the one who doubted. As a result, I came to believe that doubt is the enemy of faith. But is that really true?

title: Can You Be a "Calminian"? Calvinism vs. Arminianism
description:
The debate between Calvinism and Arminianism is surely one of the most intractable in all of Christendom, but that hasn't stopped countless people from continuing to pursue that elusive golden mean known as "Calminianism". So is it possible to split the difference between the two and be a Calminian?

As in so many things in life, the answer is yes ... and no.

title: Why every Christian should be a Hopeful Universalist
description: In this video, I explain why every Christian should accept hopeful universalism, that is, the hope that everyone will ultimately be reconciled to God in Jesus Christ, either in this life or the next.

title: Do the size and age of the universe provide a reason to think Christianity is false?
description: In this short video, I argue that the size and age of the universe may provide prima facie evidence against anthropocentrism, but not Christianity.

title: Is belief in God like belief in Santa Claus?
description: Santa Claus, apologetics, parody religion

title: How do you explain God to a six year old?
description: In this brief reflection theologian Randal Rauser explains the concept of God's transcendence.

title: Making Sense of Grace
description: In this short interview Randal Rauser describes the search for God's grace in his most recent book, "What's So Confusing About Grace?"

title: The Church as Tabasco Sauce
description: When Tabasco Sauce loses its spice, can it be made spicy again?

title: Apologetics: Why do good apologetic arguments produce bad results?
description: Have you ever noticed that apologetic arguments for the truth of Christianity often come up short? Rather than winning converts or at least answering objections, they become the subject of ridicule and incredulity. Why is that and what can we do about it? In this video apologist Randal Rauser explores this phenomenon and offers two solutions.

title: In Search of Salvation
description:
Christianity promises the "Good News" of salvation. But what does it mean to be saved? Is it about praying a sinner's prayer? Or following the Four Spiritual Laws? Believing particular doctrines or doing good works? And why isn't any of this clearer? Randal Rauser became a Christian when he was five years old. Now, four decades later, things are just starting to make sense. 
To learn more, read the book "What's So Confusing About Grace?"

title: What's So Confusing About Grace? The Book
description: When did the simple good news get so complicated?

title: Is Allah the god of the Bible? | The 59 Second Apologist
description: In this episode of The 59 Second Apologist, Randal addresses the question of whether Allah is the God of the Bible.

title: What is Perfect Being Theology? | The 59 Second Apologist
description: In this episode of the 59 Second Apologist, Randal introduces the topic of perfect being theology, and considers a couple common objections to it.

title: What is Truth? |  The 59 Second Apologist
description: In this episode of the 59 Second Apologist, Randal defines the concept of truth.

title: What is Apologetics? |  The 59 Second Apologist
description: In this episode of the 59 Second Apologist, Randal explains what apologetics is and responds to a common objection to it.

title: The Parable Of The Good Atheist
description: A retelling of Jesus' most famous parable.

title: "Finding God In The Shack" Interview Part 2
description: An interview with Randal Rauser, author of "Finding God in the Shack" on "Celebration" with Marcus and Joni Lamb

title: "Finding God In The Shack" Interview Part 1
description: An interview with Randal Rauser, author of "Finding God in the Shack" on "Celebration" with Marcus and Joni Lamb
